observationTitle: Antimicrobial or antimalarial taken within 72 hours
contraindicationText: Do not vaccinate if the patient  has taken antimicrobial or antimalarial medications  within the previous 72 hours.
clarifyingText: A longer interval should be considered for long-acting antimicrobials [e.g., the antimalarial agents mefloquine and chloroquine and the combinations atovaquone/proguanil and pyrimethamine/sulfadoxine can, at doses used for prophylaxis, be administered together with the Ty21a vaccine; however, the manufacturer advises that other antimalarial agents only be administered at least 3 days after the last vaccine dose).
